sn40.8:3.1: 8 A Question About the Dimension of Neither Perception Nor Non-Perception
sn40.8:4.1: “‘They speak of this thing called the “dimension of neither perception nor non-perception”.
sn40.8:4.2: What is the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception?’
sn40.8:4.4: ‘It’s when a mendicant—going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness—enters and remains in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn40.8:4.5: This is called the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
sn40.8:4.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn40.8:4.7: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of nothingness beset me.
sn40.8:5.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic powers and said:
sn40.8:5.3: Don’t neglect the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; unify your mind and bring it to samādhi in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
sn40.8:5.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn40.8:5.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.8:5.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
